doc.field: Transcontinental Gas Pipe Line Corp said that it is not willing to accept the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission's conditioned approval of its proposed offer of settlement dated May 13. Transco said it filed a revised settlement proposal which would permit it to become an open access transporter while restructuring gas sales services. The new offer includes a gas supply inventory charge to customers who fail to buy 60 pct of their annual contract quantities and 35 pct of their summer contract quantities. Reuter
